heading: celebrity table scraps
subheading: when paul mccartney's children learned that a piece of toast nibbled by fellow beatle george harrison fetched us$40,000 at a memorabilia auction, they thought they'd discovered a gold mine. like hungry puppies, they were suddenly after their father to leave behind his half-eaten breakfasts. it just goes to show that if you're famous enough, there's no such thing as garbage. "since the first wild beatles years, i've come to terms with the fact that the world is a crazy place," mccartney said in an interview with der spiegel news magazine.
author: wired staff
text: when paul mccartney's children learned that a piece of toast nibbled by fellow beatle george harrison fetched us$40,000 at a memorabilia auction, they thought they'd discovered a gold mine. like hungry puppies, they were suddenly after their father to leave behind his half-eaten breakfasts. it just goes to show that if you're famous enough, there's no such thing as garbage. "since the first wild beatles years, i've come to terms with the fact that the world is a crazy place," mccartney said in an interview with  der spiegel news magazine.
